Some of our "unsung heroes" at Leipsic Local School District are our bus drivers. They receive little recognition for their jobs....yet without them.....we would be lost. Their job of transporting our students to and from school each and every day no matter the weather conditions is by far one of our greatest responsibilities as a school district. This year we recognize two our drivers who have met a milestone for their years of service.

Dave (Guido) Schroeder who has been with the Leipsic School District for 30 years. Congratulations Guido!!

Randy Haselman who has been with the Leipsic School District for 15 years. Congratulations Randy!

Please be mindful of the big yellow buses on the roadways. The rest of the county schools start their school year this week as well.....leave early, drive slow, and watch for the flashing yellow & red lights on the school bus. These drivers are very passionate about their jobs and just want to make sure the school children arrive safely to and from school.
#vikingpride

The Leipsic Local School staff would like to express our sincere thanks to the staff of The Meadows of Leipsic. There were an array of different emotions surrounding this 1st day of school of the new school year. They know all too well the regulations that are imposed due to covid-19 and as a gesture of unity, they sent in lunch for the school staff members. A way of saying........we got your back and thank you for what you do. One of the greatest assets of living in a small rural community is knowing that someone will always be there for you. They say it takes a village to raise a child......it truly does. Students need the support of the school staff. The school staff needs the support of the community. Together we will get through this......teachers & parents & community working together for the good of the students.

Thank you to The Meadows of Leipsic, you are a valued member of our community.

Prior to your child attending their jr/sr prom or their class trip or receiving their diploma.....all fees have to be paid in full.

LHS Graduation - Class of 2020
When: May 30th

We need the help of the community to honor our Class of 2020 graduates. There graduation ceremony will begin with a parade through town starting at the Leipsic Fogle Center and ending at Leipsic High School. The parade will run up Orchard Drive and down Main Street. The parade will begin @ 4:00 pm.

Please line the streets and show our Seniors your support!!

The ceremony will then take place in the east parking lot where each senior and their family will be in an assigned parking spot (numbers are limited). We will run through a ceremony just like what we would have in the gymnasium. Social distancing will be exercised.

It takes a village to raise a child.....and we are confident our village will come together and support this graduating class during these unprecedented times!!!!
